page.title: 17HOLTON AREA FLORA
page.content: Wickenby Wood-Preservation evidence of ancient woodland colonised by trees since the Ice age glaciers.A prominent tree is the Leaved Lime which dates back 5,000 years. In the 1960's part of the woodland was felled and re-planted with Norway Spruce.Oak is the only tree being planted now to grow on to maturity. There are four varieties of orchids as well as primroses, herbs, and grasses, forget me-nots, lily-of-the-valley, blue bell pink clover, buttercups, violets, daisies and dandelions. Other wild flowers in the surrounding area include poppy,chickweed,dogrose, ivies,cowparsley,ground elder,nettles bindweed,hops,sorrel,docks,foxglove, comfrey,speedwell,bilberry,ribwort, harebell, groundsel and ragwort, the latter containing an alkaloid poison even after drying.
